name: The Inn at Sugar Hollow Farm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about our stay. If you enjoy a country setting and top notch service, this is the place to go. The inkeepers were friendly and willing to help make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The building and the grounds are well maintained. The attention to detail and the breakfast were simply amazing. If you want to relax and get away from it all, by all means pick this B&B.
reviews.title: Perfection with class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was a perfect Virginia experience for me. The house is absolutely gorgeous, carefully designed. The themes of the rooms were very Virginian and added wonders to the atmosphere. I even had a chance to sit on the deck and read a bit with the mountains as the backdrop. It was incredibly relaxing!! I highly recommend this b and b. I also plan to stay here again!
reviews.title: The quintessential bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: Spent the 4th of July weekend at Sugar Hollow. Outstanding hosts and accommodations. The breakfasts were fantastic. Would recommend this B&B to anyone.
reviews.title: Outstanding 4th...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled over 3000miles from England not really knowing what to expect from our choice of vacation in Sugar Hollow. We were greeted warmly by our hosts and our every need was catered for. This is a very special place in a great location and after a hectic few days at our sons wedding in Middlleburg, we could not have found a better place to chill out and relax. We would recommend the Inn to anyone- rate it very highly.
reviews.title: A very special place in an idyllic location with excellent hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peter & Elaine Emmott, Bubwith, East Yorkshire, England
reviews.title: Friendly and comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn at Sugar Hollow is a great place to relax, close to many tourist attractions in the Charlottsville area. We stayed in the Shenandoah Suite which was hugh and perfectly appointed. Food and hospitality were wonderful, and we loved seeing all the wildlife. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodations were excellent. The hosts were gracious and very helpful during our stay. We are planning a return trip in the next few months.
reviews.title: Hospitality at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn at Sugar Hollow Farm was just what we were looking for. A quiet get-away place located at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains...absolutely gorgeous location. Free public access to hiking trails just 5 minutes down the road. Fantastic food just 15 minutes away in cozy downtown Crozet...several top-of-the line resturants without the crowds. We booked the Shenandoah Suite for added privacy...perfect! Extra touches in the room were pleasant surprises--refrig stocked with drinks, calling card, coffee & hot chocolate, popcorn, etc. Great information from the inn keepers for folks like us who aren't familiar with the area; no matter what you're looking for, Dick & Hayden know where to send you. We didn't mind having breakfast with the other guests, although this may detract from the experience for others. Bottom line--if you're looking for a quiet, clean, relaxing place that's outside of town, a place surrounded with beautiful scenery and wildlife, a place with outdoor activities and great food just around the corner, a place that's only a 20 minute country drive away from downtown Charlottesville, then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the beautiful surroundings and the attention to detail. The beds were extremely high quality and comfortable. There was nothing that we needed that wasn't provided.....down to a pre-paid phone card if we needed to use the Inn phone (our cell phones didn't work here). We loved the quiet privacy (and the porch swing) of the Farmhouse (we were the only ones there).
reviews.title: A beautiful retreat in a relaxed country setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Sugar hollow in June for our anniversary. Location is great, very quiet beautiful rolling hills and trees. Wildlife roams the area. Breakfast was very good, hosts were great. The view from our room was awesome. Went biking along the road over the weekend and the only vehicles I saw were a seldom car and other bikes. Highly recommend and we will go again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We can underline the comments made by other reviewers, this is a B&B with delux hotel standards, an outstanding location and a very warm welcome.
reviews.title: As good as they say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a real art to running a B&B, so much depends uopn the personality of the owners, and we were a little concerned that living in someone else's house would feel a little restricting. These fears were unfounded, the owners perfectly calibrate their resonse to the requirements of their guests, managing to to get it as right with reserved English people as with more outgoing Americans !
reviews.title: Unexpected luxury, serenity and romance-and that was before we even left our suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An other reviewer has commented on breakfast. It is at a fixed time, but there is no other way of organising it in a B&B, and I am sure that the owners would find a way to accomodate a request for later breakfast if it was made in advance.
reviews.title: Get away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are no dining facilities on site (this is a B&B after all !) and the drive in to Charolottesville takes 30 minutes. For some this may be a drawback, but on the other hand there is an excellent selection of restaurants in Charlottesville, and a few alternatives closer by in Crozet. Our room had a microwave so you can always stop at a deli and bring back a meal.
reviews.title: Restful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this B&B as a destination in itself, as well as the perfect place to stay if visiting Charlottesville.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, but breakfast problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely accommodation deep in the countryside. Very comfortable room - we were in Wildflower - and there were many other rooms to sit in, to read, to listen to music, chat with other guests or watch TV. We sat on the sun deck watching the wildlife - hummingbirds, fox, deer and the occasional groundhog; coffee, tea and cold drinks were always available in the butler's pantry where we chilled some wine and before settling down to watch the sunset and then the fireflies. Breakfast was great and always a surprise - nothing seemed to be too much trouble for our hosts who made us feel very welcome and yet left us to ourselves to enjoy our time there. It's a perfect spot from which to enjoy the Blue Ridge, to visit Charlottesville and Monticello - quiet and peaceful after an energetic day in the hills.
reviews.title: Warm, welcoming, in a beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a beautiful evening ride through the mountains. Holding hands the entire drive, we smiled at eachother as we approached the Inn. The deer were grazing and welcoming. The serenity engulfed our spirits. We felt as if all this beauty was there just for us. The night sky filled with an Owl moon, the days filled with long talks by the reservoir. The memories of the Inn will stay with me forever as I replay the magic of our moment in my mind. My one true love is gone now, but I have the most wonderful memories to carry me through this loss. I will always remember his boyish smile and his laugh, his graying red hair and those blue eyes that forever looked into my soul. The Inn at Sugar Hollow Farm is an amazing place, with wonderful heart. It was the perfect place to celebrate love. I hope the joy we felt passes through the years to others...It is a wonderous thing when it's perfect.
reviews.title: A time just for us...D & T

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came for an impromtu weekend getaway to spend a night before going to visit Monticello, and wanted a relaxing evening at a nice B&B. The Inn at Sugar Hollow Farm was exactly what we were looking for and much more. My only regret is that we were not able to stay longer.
reviews.title: Will definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Wildflower Room, the views were just a amazing as were promised. The bathroom had a fantastic tub with little spa touches like slippers, robes, and neck pillows.
reviews.title: Your every need is anticipated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The whole place was very clean and homey, without the usual B&B kitch, just classy country touches. They really do think of everything here and you will feel very relaxed. They offer suggestions for dinner places approximately 15 minutes away.
reviews.title: A Perfectly Heavenly Hideaway!

aka: The Inn At Sugar Hollow Farm Hotel
description: The Inn at Sugar Hollow Farm is located on 70 serene acres surrounded by picturesque mountains, majestic hardwood forests and rushing woodland streams. Unwind in your whirlpool tub or in front of the fireplace in one of our nine elegant guestrooms. Whether you choose to explore nearby historic areas, to tour and taste at local wineries, or to hike in the Shenandoah National Park, your stay at the Inn will be both relaxing and memorable.
